attributes.action: call on the Independent Commission on MPs' Renumeration to base new MPs' 'market rate' on an average of their last three years' salaried income.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
MPs should be given a salary that reflects their individual 'market rate', not just a uniform rate. However, this can be difficult to establish as different people are worth different salaries. To make things fairer, any new MP should be given a salary which is the average of their last three years' SALARIED INCOME. Any income from shares, pensions, etc, would not be counted. The upper limit should be £250,000pa, to attract the brightest. There should also be a lower limit of £20,000pa, so as not to discourage the low paid, unemployed, voluntary workers, OAPs, etc, from taking office. Every year, this salary would increase by the rate of inflation. At elections, the proposed salaries should be displayed beside each candidate’s name.

Granting this petition would ensure that MPs were paid what the 'real world' thought they were worth. It is a simple and clear system that will protect the Commission from accusations of bias or being out-of-touch.

rejection.details: Petitions to the Number 10 site should request an action that can be taken by the Prime Minister or Government. The Government cannot tell an independent commission what recommendations to make. You may wish to re-word your petition.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
